channel.title: NPC: Hit reactions
channel.description:
Ever noticed, that enemies and allies in HL2 never showed a reaction, if they were hit by a gunshot (excepting death)?
[url]https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=Aaj7z35VTFM&feature=related[/url]
That's like shooting...somehting that feels no pain...and that's simply annoying in my eyes!
The zombies in L4D for example have hit animations and also in HL1, npcs performed an animation, too: [url]https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=KwJG9zMyClk&feature=related[/url] (the arms of the barneys swing backwards, if you shoot them)
Maybe it is a little bit too late for this, but I would really suggest to implement pain reactions!

item.title: NPC: Hit reactions
item.dc:creator: brokenfridgehinge
item.description:
obsidian:

I suggest looking in to NaturalMotion’s Euphoria engine (like in Grand Theft Auto 4) the hit reaction is amazing and the characters react respectively to their environments (grab on to ledges and other characters to save themselves, fall properly and NOT on their feet as if gravity ddnt apply) I’m sure its possible. :3… maybe a little ambitious but still… none the less possible…

It’s possible if the team had millions to spend on a license which really wouldn’t provide that much of a benefit this late in to development. In fact, it would be rather redundant in a game such as Half-Life, where most things can be handled by scripted animations and events. Too bad Natural Motion doesn’t license their engine to independent dev teams, only to large publishers and developers. So yeah, your suggestion is kind of null.
